question: What are the end products of the shikimate pathway?
ideal_answer: The shikimate pathway responsible for the generation of aromatic amino acids

snippets.text: The shikimate pathway is indispensable for the biosynthesis of natural products with aromatic moieties.
In plants, the shikimate pathway generally occurs in plastids and leads to the biosynthesis of aromatic amino acids.
the shikimate pathway responsible for the generation of aromatic amino acids
Microorganisms are able to synthesize aromatic amino acids through the shikimate pathway.
aromatic amino acid synthesis via the shikimate pathway
